title: Firefighters soothe child traumatized by car crash by letting her paint their nails
text:
North Davis Fire Department Battalion Chief Allen Hadley and Captain Kevin Lloyd let a little girl paint their nails to distract her from a traffic accident she’d been involved in – and were happy to share the results after (Picture: North Davis FD/Facebook)

Two kindly firefighters soothed a little girl left badly shaken by a car crash by letting the youngster paint their nails.

Battalion Chief Allen Hadley and Captain Kevin Lloyd noticed the youngster clutching a bottle of polish after the smash in North Davis, Utah, on Saturday.

It left her badly shaken but physically unharmed.

The firefighters began asking her about the product, and even offered to let her paint their nails in a bid to distract her from the frightening scene around her.

And she did just that – with Hadley and Lloyd showing off the youngster’s handiwork on the North Davis Fire District Facebook page shortly afterwards.

One of the two firefighters showed off a close-up of his colorful new nails after letting the youngster paint them. Chief Hadley and Captain Lloyd were hailed for their quick-thinking kindness towards the girl (Picture: North Davis Fire Department/Facebook)

Afterwards, one of the two men showed off a close-up of his hand showing his newly-painted purple nails.

A spokesman said: ‘This is how amazing our firefighters are.

‘Our A shift Battalion Chief and Captain were on the scene of a motor vehicle accident where a small female child was not injured but very scared.

‘After noticing the child was holding bottles of fingernail polish, these 2 officers started talking to her about her polish and asked her I’d she would paint their nails.

‘Within minutes, the child was calmly paining their nails and had forgotten about the accident she had just experienced.

‘Great job Chief Hadley and Captain Lloyd for providing awesome customer service to one of our young citizens.’
description: Batallion Chief Allen Hadley and Captain Kevin Lloyd came up with the ingenious plan after being called out to a crash in North Davis, Utah
